intro: Guzmania calothyrsus, commonly known as the red-tipped guzmania, is a species of flowering plant in the Bromeliaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. This plant is characterized by its striking rosette of dark green leaves with a distinctive red stripe running down the central axis. The inflorescence consists of a vibrant red bract that bears small, white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated as a decorative houseplant due to its ornamental value.
